intro: Gymnandra ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf gymnandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its ovate, glossy leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Gymnandra ovata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
